content.rendered:
The University of La Verne experience is not meant to be just professors, textbooks, classes, homework and exams. It is an exploration of something new and a discovery of yourself and others. The residence halls are where the journey begins!

Citrus Hall

Citrus Hall, which opened in Fall 2018, is a five-story building that includes community lounges, study spaces, and a 16,600 square foot dining hall known as The Spot. The residence hall portion will house approximately 400 students, mostly first-year students and a select amount of available spaces reserved for continuing students.

Learn More
Vista La Verne

Vista La Verne is a stylish home for 378 students. The units are suite style with each unit having two single rooms, two double rooms and 4 private bathrooms and a living-room.

Learn More
The Oaks

The Oaks is ideal for students interested in making friends and developing a strong sense of community! Comprised of six “houses,” these halls are home to approximately 250 students. The floors are co-ed and have separate gendered bathrooms.

Learn More
